views.markdown:
Compatible with iOS 9, 10, and 11.

All devices running iOS 11.2.6 and higher do not need this tweak installed --

Prevents Telugu characters from crashing apps and SpringBoard. This tweak replaces the Telugu character with "❌Removed❌", preventing a crash (and a potential bootloop).

The crashing process is blocked systemwide for iOS 10, and partially for iOS 11 (full support for notifications and partial support in apps)
No options to configure.

No Screenshots for this item.

Targets zero-width non joiners to remove them from dangerous strings, but in a way that doesn't break languages that depend on it (Arabic, Emojis) Fixes comparability issues with Arabic script


Patches multi-character crashes

Adds support for other languages which may cause the crash (Bengali and Devanagari)

Eliminates the use of a zero-width non joiner entirely (Stabilizes the string and prevents the crash)
